history.content: In a previous email, Prof. Hunn said that lectures will begin next week so as not to disadvantage the Tuesday section.

Thank you Anonymous reply; this is true.

I emailed everyone enrolled in CS370 thus far just a few days ago, and after just checking I see we have perhaps four students who have applied for the course between that email and today so I will process them immediately and send the same emails that I've been sending everyone enrolled.

If you received the email then read it carefully as it has all of your answers in it. That being said, Anonymous is correct in that we are starting formal classes *NEXT* week and there is no class at 2pm today. This course historically started in week 3 then moved to starting at the beginning of the term--though in this case starting next week means students will be on the same assignments each week and can pick project partners via bcourses from the other lecture which greatly increases your options.

Please feel free to email me letting me know if you recently applied for the course or if you have been registered and just didn't catch my correspondence (just put "CS370 question" in the subject line so my filter catches it). I just want to ensure that this doesn't happen to anyone else as I want everyone "in the loop" (obviously).

much appreciated!

Christopher

cthunn@berkeley.edu
Hi, the lecture is supposed to be Wednesday’s 2-4 but I haven’t received anything for 370. Is this normal? I’m not sure what to do
history.subject: Enrolled in 370 but no zoom link and/or notifications?
